intro: Cordula chamberlainiana, commonly known as the chamberlain's cordula, is a species of flowering plant native to South Africa. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in coastal or mountainous regions. It has lance-shaped leaves and produces small, clustered inflorescences.
